required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Brexpiprazole as Adjunctive Therapy in Adults With Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 4, Multicenter, Open-label, Interventional Trial to Assess the Effects on Engagement of Flexible-dose Brexpiprazole (OPC-34712) as Adjunctive Therapy for the Treatment of Adults With Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The clinical trial will investigate the effect of brexpiprazole on the concept of life engagement in patients with MDD with a current depressive episode.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a phase 4, multicenter, open-label, flexible dose trial designed to assess the effects of brexpiprazole (flexible dose; 0.5 to 2 mg QD) as adjunctive therapy to ADT on life engagement in patients with MDD. This trial is being conducted in line with the Canadian Product Monograph.

primary_outcome.measure: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology Self-Report (IDS-SR) 10-life engagement
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to Week 8 in IDS-SR-10- life engagement

primary_outcome.measure: Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology Self-Report (IDS-SR) Total score
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline to Week 8 in IDS-SR Total score

arm_group.description: Brexpiprazole as a flexible dose; 0.5 to 2 mg/day and patient will continue on the stable dose of ADT that they were taking at screening.

intervention.description: Brexpiprazole (flexible dose; 0.5 to 2 mg once daily [QD]) as adjunctive therapy to antidepressant therapy (ADT)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male and female patients (outpatients) between the regional age of majority (18 or 19 years of age) to 65 years of age, inclusive, at the time of informed consent.
- Primary diagnosis of MDD and in a current non-psychotic MDE as defined by DSM-5 criteria, who have been outpatients for at least 4 weeks, and have an inadequate response, per investigator judgment, to 1 or 2 adequate treatments of ADTs in their current MDE, including current ADT.
- Patients with a Patient Health Questionnaire 9-item scale (PHQ-9) â‰¥ 15 at the screening and baseline visits, if separate.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients currently or previously treated with brexpiprazole including patients who received brexpiprazole in any prior clinical trial.
- Patients with a concurrent DSM-5 diagnosis of the following will be excluded:
- Schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder
- Bipolar I or bipolar II disorder
- Post-traumatic stress disorder
- Dementia
- Eating disorder
- Borderline personality disorder
- Antisocial personality disorder
- Patients with a suicidality score of 3 based on IDS-SR suicidality item 18 or patients who, in the opinion of the investigator, presents a serious risk of suicide.
